page.title: 06THE KENNELS
page.content: THE KENNELS Mr. and Mrs. Crane have about twenty individual kennels at their premises. The land they own is about two thirds of an acre. The number of dogs and cats they take in varies throughout the year. The don't get many cats in but in the summer they accommodate about 35 dogs per week. In the winter they don't get very many dogs either. The fees are Â£2.20 per day but for Irish Wolf-Hounds and Great Danes they charge Â£3.50. The price difference is due to the extra feeding costs. The amount of food the dogs eat varies with size. The age range of the dogs is from 18 months to 10 years. About 50% of the dogs they take in are mongrels with the remaining 50% being pedegree.
